dt: {bc}to strengthen and secure (a place, such as a town) by {a_link|forts} or batteries
{bc}to give physical strength, courage, or endurance to
{bc}to add mental or moral strength to {bc}{sx|encourage||}
{bc}to strengthen or enhance by the addition of some substance or ingredient: such as
{bc}to add distilled grape spirits to (wine) during fermentation to increase the alcohol content

dt.t: … both the red and white versions we get in this country have been American-made-from California wine {wi}fortified{/wi} with a touch of brandy.

dt: {bc}to enrich (food) by adding ingredients (such as vitamins or minerals) to improve the nutritional value

dt.t: … make sure any soy milk you buy is {wi}fortified{/wi} with vitamin D, an essential nutrient for bone health.

et: Middle English {it}fortifien{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}fortifier{/it}, from Late Latin {it}fortificare{/it}, from Latin {it}fortis{/it} strong
shortdef: to strengthen and secure (a place, such as a town) by forts or batteries
to give physical strength, courage, or endurance to
